intro: Sabatia difformis, commonly known as the irregular beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, irregularly shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from pink to purple. Sabatia difformis is an important nectar source for native bees and other pollinators.
